titleStmt.title: The dispairing youths grief crowned with joy and happiness, by the return of his dear love. Forsaken lovers thus complain, nay, and for death will call; but when their loves return again, amends is made for all. To the tune of, Black and sullen hour. This may be printed, R.P.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby, in Pye-Corner.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "Adieu my dear whom I adore ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
